intro: Leucheria racemosa, commonly known as the clustered leech grass, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically wind-pollinated. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Leucheria racemosa is typically found in moist, disturbed soils in open habitats such as roadsides and forest edges.
